item.title: Brady add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Brady add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Brady add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Sometimes when I look at you, I feel I'm gazing at a distant star. It's dazzling, but the light is from tens of thousands of years ago. Maybe the star doesn't even exist any more. Yet sometimes that light seems more real to me than anything." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Brady add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You know you're in love when you can't fall asleep because reality is finally better than your dreams." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Brady add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.title: Brady add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Brady add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Brady add a quote by Gordon A. Eadie
item.description: "If you don't stand for something you will fall for anything." -- Gordon A. Eadie

item.title: Brady add a quote by Elbert Hubbard
item.description: "A friend is someone who knows all about you and still loves you." -- Elbert Hubbard

item.title: Brady add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Brady add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Brady add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Brady add a quote by Paul Terry
item.description: "Whenever I feel the need to exercise, I lie down until it goes away." -- Paul Terry

item.title: Brady add a quote by Miss Piggy
item.description: "Beauty is in the eye of the beholder and it may be necessary from time to time to give a stupid or misinformed beholder a black eye." -- Miss Piggy

item.title: Brady add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description:
"Never put off till tomorrow what may be done day after tomorrow just as well".
From: "More Maxims of Mark" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Brady add a quote by Brigham Young
item.description: "To be gentle and kind, modest and truthful, to be full of faith and integrity, doing no wrong is of God; goodness sheds a halo of loveliness around every person who possesses it, making their countenances beam with light, and their society desirable because of its excellency. They are loved of God, of holy angels, and of all the good earth, while they are hated, envied, admired, and feared by the wicked. " -- Brigham Young

item.title: Brady add a quote by Brigham Young
item.description: "He who takes offense when no offense is intended is a fool, and he who takes offense when offense is intended is a greater fool." -- Brigham Young

item.title: Brady add a quote by Brigham Young
item.description: "Why should we worry about what others think of us, do we have more confidence in their opinions than we do our own?" -- Brigham Young

item.title: Brady add a quote by Brigham Young
item.description: "Education is the power to think clearly, the power to act well in the world's work, and the power to appreciate life." -- Brigham Young

item.title: Brady add a quote by Brigham Young
item.description: "You educate a man; you educate a man. You educate a woman; you educate a generation." -- Brigham Young

item.title: Brady add a quote by Ezra Taft Benson
item.description: "When obedience ceases to be an irritant and becomes our quest, in that moment God will endow us with power." -- Ezra Taft Benson

item.title: Brady add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "A common mistake that people make when trying to design something completely foolproof is to underestimate the ingenuity of complete fools." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Brady add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "There is a theory which states that if ever anyone discovers exactly what the Universe is for and why it is here, it will instantly disappear and be replaced by something even more bizarre and inexplicable. There is another theory which states that this has already happened." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Brady add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "For instance, on the planet Earth, man had always assumed that he was more intelligent than dolphins because he had achieved so much&mdash;the wheel, New York, wars and so on&mdash;whilst all the dolphins had ever done was muck about in the water having a good time. But conversely, the dolphins had always believed that they were far more intelligent than man&mdash;for precisely the same reasons." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Brady add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "Time is an illusion. Lunchtime doubly so." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Brady add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The major problem&mdash;<i>one</i> of the major problems, for there are several&mdash;one of the many major problems with governing people is that of whom you get to do it; or rather of who manages to get people to let them do it to them. To summarize: it is a well-known fact that those people who must <i>want</i> to rule people are, ipso facto, those least suited to do it. To summarize the summary: anyone who is capable of getting themselves made President should on no account be allowed to do the job." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Brady add a quote by Barbara J. Winter
item.description: "When you come to the edge of all the light you know, and are about to step off into the darkness of the unknown, FAITH is knowing one of two things will happen: There will be something solid to stand on or you will be taught how to fly." -- Barbara J. Winter

item.title: Brady add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I believe in Christianity as I believe that the sun has risen: not only because I see it, but because by it I see everything else." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Brady add a quote by Neal A. Maxwell
item.description: "We should certainly count our blessings, but we should also make our blessings count." -- Neal A. Maxwell

item.title: Brady add a quote by Neal A. Maxwell
item.description: "God does not begin by asking us about our ability, but only about our availability, and if we then prove our dependability, he will increase our capability." -- Neal A. Maxwell
